definitions.definition: The suitability of ground for riding, walking etc.
examples: The going was very difficult over the ice.
We made good going for a while, but then we came to the price.

definitions.definition: Conditions for advancing in any way.
examples: Not only were the streets not paved with gold, but the going was difficult for an immigrant.

definitions.definition: Course of life; behaviour; doings; ways.

examples: I can't find my sunglasses; you haven't seen the going of them, have you?

definitions.definition: The horizontal distance between the front of one step in a flight of stairs and the front of the next.
examples: Each step had a rise of 170 mm and a going of 250 mm.

secondary_definitions: The suitability of ground for riding, walking etc.
( figurative ) Conditions for advancing in any way.
( in the plural ) Course of life; behaviour; doings; ways.
( in the phrase "the going of" ) The whereabouts (of something).
The horizontal distance between the front of one step in a flight of stairs and the front of the next.
